verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329>Musician<s%>, <S%H516>Al-taschith<s%>, <S%H4387>Michtam<s%> of <S%H1732>David<s%>; when <S%H7586>Saul<s%> <S%H7971>sent<s%>, and they <S%H8104>watched<s%> the <S%H1004>house<s%> to kill <S%H4191>him<s%>. <S%H5337>Deliver<s%> me from mine <S%H341>enemies<s%>, O my <S%H430>God<s%>: <S%H7682>defend<s%> me from them that rise <S%H6965>up<s%> against me.
<S%H5337>Deliver<s%> me from the <S%H6466>workers<s%> of <S%H205>iniquity<s%>, and <S%H3467>save<s%> me from <S%H1818>bloody<s%> <S%H582>men<s%>.

For, lo, they lie in <S%H693>wait<s%> for my <S%H5315>soul<s%>: the <S%H5794>mighty<s%> are <S%H1481>gathered<s%> against me; not for my <S%H6588>transgression<s%>, nor for my <S%H2403>sin<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>.
They <S%H7323>run<s%> and <S%H3559>prepare<s%> themselves without my <S%H5771>fault<s%>: <S%H5782>awake<s%> to <S%H7125>help<s%> me, and <S%H7200>behold<s%>.

Thou therefore, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H430>God<s%> of <S%H6635>hosts<s%>, the <S%H430>God<s%> of <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, <S%H6974>awake<s%> to <S%H6485>visit<s%> all the <S%H1471>heathen<s%>: be not <S%H2603>merciful<s%> to any <S%H205>wicked<s%> <S%H898>transgressors<s%>. <S%H5542>Selah<s%>.
They <S%H7725>return<s%> at <S%H6153>evening<s%>: they make a <S%H1993>noise<s%> like a <S%H3611>dog<s%>, and go round <S%H5437>about<s%> the <S%H5892>city<s%>.
Behold, they belch <S%H5042>out<s%> with their <S%H6310>mouth<s%>: <S%H2719>swords<s%> are in their <S%H8193>lips<s%>: for who, say they, doth <S%H8085>hear<s%>?
But thou, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, shalt <S%H7832>laugh<s%> at them; thou shalt have all the <S%H1471>heathen<s%> in <S%H3932>derision<s%>.
Because of his <S%H5797>strength<s%> will I <S%H8104>wait<s%> upon thee: for <S%H430>God<s%> is my <S%H4869>defence<s%>.
The <S%H430>God<s%> of my <S%H2617>mercy<s%> shall <S%H6923>prevent<s%> me: <S%H430>God<s%> shall let me <S%H7200>see<s%> my desire upon mine <S%H8324>enemies<s%>.

<S%H2026>Slay<s%> them not, lest my <S%H5971>people<s%> <S%H7911>forget<s%>: <S%H5128>scatter<s%> them by thy <S%H2428>power<s%>; and bring them <S%H3381>down<s%>, O <S%H136>Lord<s%> our <S%H4043>shield<s%>.

For the <S%H2403>sin<s%> of their <S%H6310>mouth<s%> and the <S%H1697>words<s%> of their <S%H8193>lips<s%> let them even be <S%H3920>taken<s%> in their <S%H1347>pride<s%>: and for <S%H423>cursing<s%> and <S%H3585>lying<s%> which they <S%H5608>speak<s%>.

<S%H3615>Consume<s%> them in <S%H2534>wrath<s%>, <S%H3615>consume<s%> them, that they may not be: and let them <S%H3045>know<s%> that <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H4910>ruleth<s%> in <S%H3290>Jacob<s%> unto the <S%H657>ends<s%> of the <S%H776>earth<s%>. <S%H5542>Selah<s%>.
And at <S%H6153>evening<s%> let them <S%H7725>return<s%>; and let them make a <S%H1993>noise<s%> like a <S%H3611>dog<s%>, and go round <S%H5437>about<s%> the <S%H5892>city<s%>.
Let them wander up and <S%H5128%H5128>down<s%> for <S%H398>meat<s%>, and <S%H3885>grudge<s%> if they be not <S%H7646>satisfied<s%>.

But I will <S%H7891>sing<s%> of thy <S%H5797>power<s%>; yea, I will sing <S%H7442>aloud<s%> of thy <S%H2617>mercy<s%> in the <S%H1242>morning<s%>: for thou hast been my <S%H4869>defence<s%> and <S%H4498>refuge<s%> in the <S%H3117>day<s%> of my <S%H6862>trouble<s%>.
Unto thee, O my <S%H5797>strength<s%>, will I <S%H2167>sing<s%>: for <S%H430>God<s%> is my <S%H4869>defence<s%>, and the <S%H430>God<s%> of my <S%H2617>mercy<s%>.
